topics.body: I've seen some awful ones in my day, but I think the worst involved futas, precariously young girls hungering for a certain part of their anatomy, and after their gruesome and bizarre "conquests", injected the poor girls with drugs to grow them back tenfold.

topics.body:
Some shit in the news:
Well fuck.  Net neutrality just got shot down in court.  Fuck you verizon!



Also oklahoma's same-sex marriage ban got curb stomped and deemed illegal.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d5f0a763687279b44f0000#post_52d5f0a763687279b44f0000
The latter is cool.

the former is good. Isn't Net Neutrality a joke perpetrated on something that has never happened, to my knowledge. And the government probably would crack down. Like jailing people for tweets in the UK.
>inb4 Netflix
Netflix was legally in the right doing what it did, it was not being oppressive.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d5f47763687214d20c0000#post_52d5f47763687214d20c0000
Net neutrality was pretty much put into place so that internet providers can't be dicks to companies they don't like.  For the most part it's not needed, but you know someone is going to deny internet access to someone they don't like and go, "CAPITALISM! 'MURICA MOTHER FUCKER!"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d5f58d6368727a6da60200#post_52d5f58d6368727a6da60200
I think the government is more likely to do it, since they are doing so already with the NSA and overseas.

And the only example of any ISP issues was the Netflix issue which was actually just Netflix denying people who were exploiting it, so they were in the right.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d5f8ec636872158d630300#post_52d5f8ec636872158d630300
The sad thing is that they already do shit like that anyhow.  Even if you don't live in the usa they can still do stuff like seizing your ip address or deny you to have any level of access to the internet through any channel that a american company owns.  So if they want to seriously get rid of you using the internet they can.  Just look at what happened to the megaupload guy.



Actually speaking of same-sex marriage it *MAY* become legalized in the usa throughout sometime soon.  The reason being with doma they couldn't find a legal basis for it, but punted it back to the states.  Well it's coming right back to the supreme court again cause of utah.  Even if they punt it back to the states no matter how they rule it will follow what happened with doma and how the number of states where it was legalized as a result increased.

So basically same-sex marriage is heading right back to the supreme court; so either A) Even more states will legalize it or B) It will become legal throughout the usa(This is actually more likely since they couldn't find any legal grounds for doma last time they ruled on it)
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
